intro: Graphephorum flexuosum, commonly known as the flexible liverwort, is a type of non-vascular plant belonging to the family Marchantiaceae. It is characterized by its leafy, thalloid structure and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a prostrate growth habit and forms dense mats on soil or rock surfaces. It reproduces through spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporophytes. Graphephorum flexuosum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitat for various small organisms.
